title: _act_
author: _act_
content: This is it:Quote from: https://cointelegraph.com/news/botswana-central-bank-crypto-risks-regulations-2024The central bank wrote: “The evolution of digital platforms and digital payment instruments that promote anonymity of transactions present an opportunity for money laundering in the financial sector.” I always think that if there is no cryptocurrencies, four things can not be eliminated in this life except people only change. They are:money laundryterrorismabduction andbanditryThe government will not talk about banditry because not cryptocurrencies that are used but paper fiat which is very anonymous. Once the kidnappers collected the money, it can not be traced. They do not deal with bitcoin or any other cryptocurrencies but deal with fiat.The bank talks about money laundering. Most money are still laundered through the use of fiat and the business people think is legit are used for it. If the source of the money is not known, the money will be in bank or somewhere else in fiat and the government will do nothing. I do not know why government should be talking about money laundering when talking about cryptocurrencies but not talking about money laundering when talking about fiat which is mostly used for money laundering.The bank talks good about cryptocurrencies but I do not like the cons that was included which is money laundering.

comments.author: Odusko
comments.body: Like I have always said, central banks will always try to put cryptocurrency in a bad spot whenever they are making public comments such as this one, the reason is that the money creators will always see Bitcoin and crypto as competition instead of accepting it as an alternative, so because of that low mentality the look away from all the possibilities that come from crypto adoptions and usage, their focus is on the fraction of disadvantage that comes through the decentralized feature of cryptocurrency.A Central Bank Governor in my country who calls cryptocurrency a tool for money laundering is currently facing money laundering cases through a currency swap that happened sometime in 2022.He accused Crypto of being an actor, meanwhile, he was busy printing unlimited money for himself and associates, until now the anti-corruption in my country is still recovering his loot through fiat, so this Botswana bank chief won't be any different from the other around the world.

comments.author: adultcrypto
comments.body: Are they looking at the security risk only without embracing the opportunity that bitcoin offer to them? Before cryptocurrency, there have been money laundering and every other challenge they listed and they are not going to stop any time soon. Instead of using this obsolete excuse to attack and discourage people from embracing bitcoin, they can simply look at how to use the positive side of it to better their country like El Salvador did. It is just unfortunate that most African countries are still looking at reasons to ban bitcoin instead of studying how to take advantage of the opportunities it offers.

comments.body: I think Botswana is just trying their best to maintain a fraud free atmosphere in the country but if they think crypto poses a threat to their financial security then they've made a huge mistake.Lets take a look at El Salvador they embraced bitcoin and even made it a legal tender,that is it can be used for payments in exchange of goods and services and this has brought the country to a very far distance bringing about economic development and financial development in the country.The central bank should think carefully before taking actions because they claim that crypto is being used for anonymous transactions contributing to money laundering forgetting that these transactions can be traced.Moreover,paper money has contributed greatly to money laundering because the exchange can't be traced enabling the thiefs loot as much as they can and get away with it.

comments.body: Only Monero can be used for money laundering, while the rest coins are unlikely to successful.If we use Bitcoin, we can use coinjoin or mixer, but there have been many explorer can make analysis and can trace the coins are associated/correlated wtih coinjoin or mixer. If CEX or banks don't want any stress, they can just freeze all the coins that associated with coinjoin or mixer.Since there are many CEX and banks ban Monero, they should have nothing to worry.

comments.author: avikz
comments.body: Bitcoin is actually bad choice for money laundering. One primary goal for money laundering is to cover the trail of money. With Bitcoin, everything is recorded on blockchain. Unless you move the transaction through a mixing service, there's no way to hide the money trail. Coins like Monero or Zcash actually makes sense when it comes to money laundering. I am sure banks have their own reasons for blaming cryptocurrency for all such illicit transactions. But as OP mentioned, some things can never be eradicated from the system, no matter how much regulations you bring in to the plate. So banks will consider cryptos as their soft target to blame because no one is there to own the blame. But that doesn't change the reality!

comments.author: Fiatless
comments.body: Quote from: _act_ on December 23, 2024, 09:18:45 AMThe bank talks good about cryptocurrencies but I do not like the cons that was included which is money laundering.The words money laundering, kidnapping for ransom, and terrorism financing have existed before cryptocurrencies were invented. My country faces almost all these problems. Politicians are the highest engagers of money laundering and I have never heard that they used crypto to facilitate this criminal act. Kidnapping happens almost every day in my area and it was only in one case that these kidnappers demanded crypto payments for ransom. Dreaded terrorist groups operate in my area such as ISIS-West Africa, Boko-Haram and others. None of them have been caught with any crypto wallet but it is common to see them in possession of physical fiat. Any type of money can be used for both positive and negative transactions. There is no need to single out only cryptos.
